description: Discretization Package - Defines the spatial and temporal discretization of the model grid

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: NLAY
variables.description: Number of layers in the model grid.
variables.tooltip: The number of model layers. Must be >= 1.

variables.name: NROW
variables.description: Number of rows in the model grid.
variables.tooltip: The number of rows in the finite-difference grid. Must be >= 1.

variables.name: NCOL
variables.description: Number of columns in the model grid.
variables.tooltip: The number of columns in the finite-difference grid. Must be >= 1.

variables.name: NPER
variables.description: Number of stress periods in the simulation.
variables.tooltip: The number of stress periods. Each stress period can have different boundary conditions and time stepping.

variables.name: ITMUNI
variables.tooltip: Indicates the time unit used throughout the model. Only affects output labeling, not calculations.

variables.name: LENUNI
variables.tooltip: Indicates the length unit used throughout the model. Only affects output labeling, not calculations.

variables.name: LAYCBD
variables.description: Flag for each layer indicating whether a quasi-3D confining bed exists below. 0=no confining bed, nonzero=confining bed present.
variables.tooltip: One value per layer. LAYCBD for the bottom layer must be 0. A nonzero value indicates a confining bed exists below that layer.

variables.name: DELR
variables.description: Width of each column (cell size along rows) in model length units.
variables.tooltip: One value per column. Specifies the width of cells along the row direction.

variables.name: DELC
variables.description: Width of each row (cell size along columns) in model length units.
variables.tooltip: One value per row. Specifies the width of cells along the column direction.

variables.name: TOP
variables.description: Top elevation of the first model layer in model length units.
variables.tooltip: 2D array (NROW x NCOL) of the top elevation of layer 1. For subsequent layers, the top is the bottom of the layer above.

datasets.description: Bottom elevations for all layers and confining beds

variables.name: BOTM
variables.description: Bottom elevation of each model layer (and confining bed) in model length units.
variables.tooltip: 2D array (NROW x NCOL) for each layer and confining bed. Read for NLAY layers plus any quasi-3D confining beds indicated by LAYCBD.

variables.name: PERLEN
variables.description: Length of the stress period in model time units.
variables.tooltip: Duration of the stress period. For steady-state stress periods, PERLEN is not used in the solution but must be specified.

variables.name: NSTP
variables.description: Number of time steps in the stress period.
variables.tooltip: Number of time steps within this stress period. More time steps give finer temporal resolution.

variables.name: TSMULT
variables.description: Time step multiplier. Length of each time step equals TSMULT times the previous step length.
variables.tooltip: Multiplier for time step length. 1.0 gives equal time steps. Values > 1.0 give increasing step sizes (common: 1.2-1.5).

variables.name: Ss/tr
variables.description: Stress period type: 'SS' for steady state or 'TR' for transient.
variables.tooltip: 'SS' means steady-state (storage terms ignored), 'TR' means transient (storage terms active). The first stress period is commonly SS.
